citeinfo.origin: Tohoku National Fisheries Research Institute (TNFRI), Fisheries Oceanography Division
citeinfo.title: Off-Tohoku Temperature Maps and Gridded Data

descript.abstract:
TNFRI has produced off-Tohoku temperature maps (Tohoku is the district name of the northeastern part of the main island in Japan - Honshu) using temperature data observed in the Mixed Water Region (MWR). MWR is the Oyashio-Kuroshio inter-frontal zone. Temperature maps and drawn using hydrographic data collect by Local Fisheries Stations, Meteorological Agency, Maritime Safety Agency, Marine Defense, Fisheries, etc. See the full list of agencies at http://ss.myg.affrc.go.jp/kaiyo/kaiyoubu/kankei.html. The Temperature maps of 1984 and 1994 through 2003 are available at http://ss.myg.affrc.go.jp/kaiyo/temp/temp.html. The target domain is 140-159E and 34-45N. Historically, 100 m depth isotherms have been drawn monthly by hand since 1944. Grid data sets with a 5-minute resolution for both longitude and latitude using the flex Gaussian interpolation method have been created. Also created are temperature maps at 0 m, 50 m, 200 m, 300 m, and 400 m from gridded data.
[ Reference: PICES Scientific Report No. 18 2001, Proceedings of the PICES/CoML/IPRC Workshop on "Impact of Climate Variability on Observation and Prediction of Ecosystem and Biodiversity Changes in the North Pacific", http://www.pices.int/publications/scientific_reports/Report18/default.aspx. ]
descript.purpose: To understand the ecosystem supporting the high productivity of the Mixed Water Region in the northwestern Pacific Ocean east of the Tohoku district.

distinfo.distliab: While every effort has been made to ensure that these data are accurate and reliable within the limits of the current state of the art, NOAA cannot assume liability for any damages caused by any errors or omissions in the data, nor as a result of the failure of the data to function on a particular system. NOAA makes no warranty, expressed or implied, nor does the fact of distribution constitute such a warranty.
